question:
Which of the following workshop methodologies were used? Select all that apply:
     action research, cooperative method development, speculative design, persona, scenario, role playing, 
     affinity diagram, ideation, user journey, brainstorming, bodystorming, design probe, prototyping, mock-up,

     other (please specify)
answer: The workshop methodologies used were cooperative method development, affinity diagram, ideation, user journey, brainstorming, bodystorming, design probe, and prototyping.
reasoning: Based on the information provided in the passage, it can be inferred that the workshop sessions involved a combination of techniques to facilitate user-centered design. Cooperative method development involves working together with users and other stakeholders to develop a method or approach. Affinity diagram is a technique used to group similar ideas or concepts together. Ideation involves generating new ideas or solutions, while user journey mapping involves understanding the user's experience and identifying opportunities for improvement. Brainstorming and bodystorming are techniques used to generate ideas and prototype solutions. Design probe is a method used to gather feedback and insights from users on a design concept. Prototyping involves creating a preliminary version of a product or service, while mock-up and sketching involve creating visual representations of an idea or concept. Card sorting and storyboarding are techniques used to help designers understand user needs and preferences. Use case theater and object theater are methods used to role-play and act out scenarios involving users and products or services.
